Line 15: Line 15:
'''GParted''' (abbreviated as '''GPT''') is the [[GNOME]] [[GNU Parted]] frontend and the official GNOME Partition Editor application.
'''GParted''' (abbreviated as '''GPT''') is the [[GNOME]] [[GNU Parted]] frontend and the official GNOME Partition Editor application.
â
It is used for creating, destroying, resizing, moving, checking and copying [[Partition (computing)|partitions]], and the [[file systems]] on them. This is useful for creating space for new operating systems (works with Vista System & Data partitions), reorganizing disk usage, copying data residing on hard disks and mirroring one partition with another (disk imaging).
+
It is used for creating, delete, resizing, moving, checking and copying [[Partition (computing)|partitions]], and the [[file systems]] on them. This is useful for creating space for new operating systems (works with Vista System & Data partitions), reorganizing disk usage, copying data residing on hard disks and mirroring one partition with another (disk imaging).
It uses [[GNU Parted|libparted]] to detect and manipulate devices and partition tables while several (optional) file system tools provide support for file systems not included in libparted. These optional packages will be detected at runtime and do not require a rebuild of GParted.
It uses [[GNU Parted|libparted]] to detect and manipulate devices and partition tables while several (optional) file system tools provide support for file systems not included in libparted. These optional packages will be detected at runtime and do not require a rebuild of GParted.
